result.execSummary:
The defendant Wesley Jock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW hearing December 4, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 40.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No violent contact with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete anger management counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pa all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wesley Jock in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Wesley Jock in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
 Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wesley Jock in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2 and Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 and Count 3 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Jury trial is vacated.  Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Violent Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Wesley Jock in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 8/10/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Wesley Jock in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State is ready to proceed.  Defense counsel requested an adjournment as his child is ill.  Court granted the request.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wesley Jock in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/22/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Statements made by Carmen J.  Court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant Wesley Jock in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for deferred prosecution agreement which was not approved by the state.    Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM018576  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-27-15
Court modified the no contact order to allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation as long as the defendant maintains absolute sobriety.

Defendant Wesley Jock in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  Carmen J.    AND/OR   her residence     AND/OR  her place of employment

Any weapons owned by the defendant to be removed from the residence and given to another party no later than 5:00 p.m. on 03-22-2015 for safekeeping pending the outcome of this case.
Thereafter,
No dangerous weapons
No firearms

Defendant Wesley Jock in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-055

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/20/15 @ 1:30pm
